alert.note: Alert for Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 815 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Abita Springs, or 11 miles east of Covington, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pearl River and Abita Springs. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 67 and 71. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 4 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
